snippet: On-site clinics, like one in Green Bay, Wis., can improve workers’ health and lower companies’ costs.
abstract: Editorial highlights the work done by not-for-profit health care system Bellin Health, which has been chosen by the federal government as one of 32 pioneering groups to test a new Medicare payments system that rewards providers if they reduce spending but penalizes them if costs soar; outlines the way in which Bellin's policies, particularly in improving access to health care at workplaces, have increased the quality of the medical care they provide while reining in costs.
lead_paragraph: On-site clinics, like one in Green Bay, Wis., can improve workers’ health and lower companies’ costs.
